greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Follow n+2 by n. Also solution of a(n+2)=a(n)+1, a(0)=2, a(1)=0.
link: Index entries for two-way infinite sequences
formula: a(n) = n + 1 - a(n-1) (with a(0)=2). - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 08 2010
a(n) = floor(n/2)*3 - floor((n-1)/2)*2. - _Ross La Haye_, Mar 27 2013
mathematica: lst={}; a=1; Do[a=n-a; AppendTo[lst, a], {n, 0, 100}]; lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Dec 14 2008 *)
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jun 15 2003
ext: First part of definition adjusted to match offset by _Klaus Brockhaus_, Nov 23 2009
